Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -squaredDistanceToVector:
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns the squared distance between two vectors. It is less computationally expensive than distanceToVector:, since it doesn’t need to apply square root in its calculation.

Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -squaredLength
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns the squared length of the vector. It is less computationally expensive than length, since it doesn’t need to apply square root in its calculation.

Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -multiplyByScalar:
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns the vector with its x and y coordinates multiplied by a scalar.

Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -divideByScalar:
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns the vector with its x and y coordinates divided by a scalar.

Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -normalized
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns the vector with its length equal to 1, preserving the direction. It can be used, for example, to simplify some operations when you only need the direction of the vector.

Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -dotProductWithVector:
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns the dot product of two vectors. It can be used, for example, to compute the angle between two vectors.

Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -perpDotProductWithVector:
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns the perp dot product of two vectors. The perp dot product is the dot product of the first vector rotated by 90 degrees counterclockwise and the second vector.

Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -signedAngleToVector:
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns the signed angle, in radians, from the vector to another vector.

Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -description
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns a string representation of the vector. Useful for printing the vector on the screen.

Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.name: -isEqual:
Classes/VTVector2.html#/c:objc(cs)VTVect.abstract: Returns a boolean which indicates if the vector is equal to possibly another vector based on their coordinates. Doesn’t account for floating-point rounding errors.

Classes/VTVector2.html.name: VTVector2
Classes/VTVector2.html.abstract: 2D vector type to represent and work with vectorial quantities, like velocity.
